abstract: Bank of America told a federal judge it wanted a jury to decide a case brought by the Securities and Exchange Commission over bonuses paid to Merrill Lynch executives.
snippet: Bank of America told a federal judge it wanted a jury to decide a case brought by the Securities and Exchange Commission over bonuses paid to Merrill Lynch executives.
lead_paragraph: Bank of America told a federal judge it wanted a jury to decide a case brought by the Securities and Exchange Commission over bonuses paid to Merrill Lynch executives. Bank of America on Friday filed a one-sentence demand for a jury trial, instead of a judge trial, in federal court in Manhattan. The S.E.C. made an identical demand two days ago.

headline.main: Bank of America Seeks Jury Trial
headline.print_headline: Bank Of America Seeks Jury Trial

abstract: The investment manager BlackRock said on Friday that the Bank of America executives Sallie L. Krawcheck and Mark D. Linsz had joined its board.
snippet: The investment manager BlackRock said on Friday that the Bank of America executives Sallie L. Krawcheck and Mark D. Linsz had joined its board.
lead_paragraph: The investment manager BlackRock said on Friday that the Bank of America executives Sallie L. Krawcheck and Mark D. Linsz had joined its board. Ms. Krawcheck, 44, is president of global wealth and investment management for Bank of America, and former chief financial officer for Citigroup. She left the board of the computer maker Dell last week, citing the need to focus on her duties with Bank of America. Mr. Linsz, 45, is corporate treasurer for Bank of America.

headline.main: Two From Bank of America Join Blackrock Board
headline.print_headline: Two From Bank of America Join Blackrock Board
